message:
Speak Geek ... :D !
I suggest making reputation and negative votes system for this group ..
to know how geeks see certain content ! is it useful ? nooby ? .. and keep the content as rich as possible ...

any ideas  ?

data.message: Is such thing doable using Facebook?
I think so .. why not ! how ABP manipulate fb by deleting ads ..
I honestly don't understand the obsession with ranking/reps/points .. this is the second post I see talking about something like that in less than a week.

just for a growing a better community ... for example when I lose rep. in stackoverflow I feel so bad and try to write the next question/answer in more detailed and obvious way ...
I envy them their enthusiasm building a great community ... and teaching n00bs how to-dos .. so they turn Pro.'s in a shorter time !

As far as I understand, this is not what this group is about. I wouldn't expect any recognition if I was able to help someone. SO is about making the best help (eco)system for coders. This group is about helping "Egyptian geeks" find each other and connect. I could be wrong.

This is not an academic circle, nor should it be. This is not a place to boost your ego or demonstrate superiority. I understand the need for simple rules like no job posting and no trivial questions. But this line of thinking is just one more step towards making this group hostile and judgemental.

No, I think the group is about exchanging opinions. If you agree with someone like him, if you disagree comment, if you think its place is not here, report it.
Adding a reputation system to something like this, wouldn't mean that someone's contributions are useful, just that he is most average and many people identify with what he writes (and therefore +1 him).

But yes, this isn't particularly difficult to do. Search for Greasemonkey if you want to see similar things in action (You will need a server to store rep though).

Ahmed Fatoum said everything I wanted to say. This group is for exchange between peers. Ranking people doesn't mix with "peers". Ranking content is already built in.

Technically also I cannot expect to ask thousands of members to use specific hack or browser extension to use the group. That's just not gonna happen.
A real geek works and studies and helps others out of his love for technology, any other reason denies him of being a geek :) no recognition needed
